definitions: person employed to protect someone from physical harm or danger
examples: The celebrity traveled everywhere with her bodyguard
Two bodyguards escorted the diplomat through the crowd

definitions: external metal shell and panels that form the outer structure of a vehicle
hands-on therapeutic treatment involving massage manipulation or movement of the body
examples: The car's bodywork was damaged in the accident
We need to repaint the bodywork after removing the rust
She specializes in bodywork techniques for chronic pain relief
The therapist recommended bodywork sessions to improve his posture

definitions: area of wet muddy ground too soft to support heavy weight
examples: The hikers carefully avoided the bog near the trail
Peat moss grows abundantly in the ancient bog

definitions: golf score of one stroke over par for a hole
unidentified aircraft or enemy target tracked on radar
examples: He made a bogey on the difficult par-four hole
She was disappointed with three bogeys in her round
The pilot reported a bogey approaching from the east
Radar detected multiple bogeys entering restricted airspace

definitions: wheeled truck under a locomotive or railway car that supports and guides it
examples: The train's front bogie needed urgent maintenance work
Each bogie has four wheels mounted on two axles

definitions: person who lives an unconventional artistic lifestyle rejecting conventional values and behavior
examples: The bohemian artist lived in a colorful studio apartment
Many bohemians gathered at the coffee shop to discuss philosophy

definitions: sealed vessel in which water is heated to produce steam or hot water
examples: The building's boiler provides heat for all apartments
We need to service the boiler before winter arrives

definitions: process of heating liquid until it bubbles and turns to vapor
examples: The boiling of water takes longer at high altitudes
Careful timing of the boiling ensures perfect pasta texture

definitions: throwing weapon with weighted balls connected by cords used for hunting
examples: The gaucho skillfully threw the bola to catch the runaway cattle
Ancient hunters used the bola to bring down swift prey

definitions: thick heavy printing type used to emphasize text or headings
examples: Important terms appear in boldface throughout the textbook
She highlighted the deadline using boldface in the email

definitions: traditional Spanish dance in triple time with castanets
women's short jacket open at the front without fastenings
examples: The dancers performed a passionate bolero at the festival
Ravel's Bolero is one of classical music's most famous pieces
She wore a stylish bolero over her evening dress
The velvet bolero complemented her formal outfit perfectly

definitions: rounded seed capsule of cotton or flax plants containing seeds and fibers
examples: Cotton bolls burst open when ready for harvest
Each boll contains about thirty cotton seeds inside

definitions: large single-edged knife used in the Philippines for clearing vegetation
examples: The farmer used a bolo to clear the overgrown path
Traditional bolo knives have wooden handles and curved blades

definitions: large smoked sausage made of seasoned mixed meats usually sliced for sandwiches
examples: He made a bologna sandwich for his lunch
The deli offers several varieties of bologna by the pound

definitions: long firm pillow or cushion placed under other pillows for support
examples: She placed a bolster under her knees while sleeping
The decorative bolster added elegance to the bedroom design

definitions: metal pin with thread for fastening things together with a nut
roll of cloth of standard width typically forty yards long
sudden dash or movement to escape or flee quickly
examples: Tighten the bolt securely to hold the parts together
We need larger bolts for this heavy-duty construction project
The fabric store sells silk by the bolt
She bought an entire bolt of cotton for the quilting project
The horse made a sudden bolt toward the open gate
His bolt from the meeting surprised everyone present

definitions: member of bomber aircraft crew responsible for aiming and releasing bombs
examples: The bombardier carefully calculated the target coordinates
World War II bombardiers underwent extensive training programs

definitions: continuous attack with bombs artillery or other missiles on a target
examples: The city endured heavy bombardment throughout the night
Naval bombardment preceded the amphibious landing operation

definitions: military aircraft designed to drop bombs on ground targets
person who plants or detonates bombs especially for terrorist purposes
examples: The bomber squadron flew missions over enemy territory
Strategic bombers can carry both conventional and nuclear weapons
Police arrested the bomber before another attack occurred
Security cameras helped identify the subway bomber quickly

definitions: piece of news or information that causes great surprise or shock
very attractive woman who draws attention with striking appearance
examples: The resignation announcement was a complete bombshell
Her bombshell revelation changed the entire investigation
The blonde bombshell starred in several Hollywood films
She entered the party looking like a total bombshell

definitions: situation that creates sudden great wealth profit or good fortune
examples: The oil discovery proved a bonanza for the small town
Online shopping has been a bonanza for delivery companies

definitions: state of being a slave or completely subject to someone else
practice of restraining someone for sexual or other purposes
examples: The prisoners endured years of bondage under harsh conditions
The novel depicts the bondage of workers in industrial society
The adult store sells various bondage equipment items
Consensual bondage requires clear communication between partners

definitions: process of forming close emotional connections between people especially parent and child
examples: Mother-infant bonding begins immediately after birth
Team bonding activities help improve workplace relationships

definitions: embarrassing mistake or blunder in judgment or action
slang term for an erect penis
examples: He made a real boner by sending the email to everyone
That boner cost the team the championship game
The teenager was embarrassed about getting a boner in class
Adolescent boys often worry about unexpected boners

definitions: large open-air fire built for warmth celebration or disposal of materials
examples: We roasted marshmallows around the beach bonfire
The community bonfire celebrated the harvest festival

definitions: water pipe used for smoking tobacco or other substances
deep resonant sound especially of a large bell
examples: The glass bong sat on the coffee table
He cleaned his bong after each use
The clock tower's bong echoed across the campus
We heard the bong of Big Ben striking midnight

definitions: pair of small drums of different sizes played with the hands
examples: The musician played rhythmic patterns on the bongo drums
Latin music often features bongo accompaniment

definitions: medium-sized predatory fish related to tuna found in warm seas
examples: The fishermen caught several bonito off the coast
Bonito makes excellent sashimi when very fresh

definitions: woman's or child's hat tied under the chin with wide brim
hinged metal cover over a vehicle's engine compartment
examples: She wore a traditional bonnet to the historical reenactment
The baby's bonnet protected her from the sun
He lifted the bonnet to check the engine oil
Steam poured from under the car's bonnet

definitions: endangered great ape closely related to chimpanzees found in Congo forests
examples: Bonobos share over 98% of their DNA with humans
The zoo's bonobo exhibit teaches visitors about conservation

definitions: art of growing ornamental miniaturized trees in containers using cultivation techniques
examples: Her bonsai collection included several hundred-year-old specimens
Learning bonsai requires patience and careful attention

definitions: sound made to show disapproval or to frighten someone
examples: The audience's loud boo showed their disappointment
Children yelled boo to scare their friends on Halloween

definitions: large tropical seabird with colorful feet that plunge-dives for fish
stupid or foolish person easily tricked or deceived
examples: Blue-footed boobies nest on the Galapagos Islands
The booby dove gracefully into the ocean for fish
Don't be such a booby and fall for that scam
The booby walked right into their practical joke

definitions: lively dance to rock music or energetic rhythmic musical style
examples: Everyone started to boogie when the band played
The disco boogie was popular in the 1970s

definitions: person who binds books professionally assembling pages into finished volumes
examples: The bookbinder restored the antique manuscript carefully
Traditional bookbinders still use hand-sewing techniques

definitions: craft or business of binding loose pages into books with covers
examples: She studied bookbinding at the art conservation school
Quality bookbinding ensures books last for generations

definitions: piece of furniture with shelves for storing and displaying books
examples: The wooden bookcase held her entire collection
We need another bookcase for the growing library

definitions: person who arranges bookings for performers venues or other entertainment services
examples: The band's booker scheduled their entire summer tour
A good booker can make or break a performer's career

definitions: person who takes bets on sporting events and pays out winnings
examples: The bookie kept detailed records of all wagers
Local bookies operated before online betting became legal

definitions: arrangement made in advance to reserve accommodations travel or services
examples: She made a booking for dinner at the restaurant
The hotel confirmed our booking for next weekend

definitions: person who maintains financial records and accounts for a business
examples: The bookkeeper reconciled all accounts before month end
Small businesses often hire part-time bookkeepers

definitions: practice of recording financial transactions and maintaining accounting records
examples: Accurate bookkeeping is essential for any successful business
She learned bookkeeping through an online certification course

definitions: small thin book with paper covers containing information on a specific topic
examples: The tourist booklet described local attractions and restaurants
She designed an informational booklet about recycling

definitions: person who calculates betting odds and accepts bets especially on horse races
examples: The bookmaker adjusted odds based on betting patterns
Professional bookmakers use complex algorithms for pricing

definitions: strip of material used to mark one's place in a book
saved shortcut to a website address in a web browser
examples: She used a leather bookmark in her favorite novel
The decorative bookmark was a thoughtful gift
He added the recipe site to his browser bookmarks
Managing bookmarks helps organize frequently visited websites

definitions: large vehicle equipped as a mobile library serving areas without library buildings
examples: The bookmobile visits rural communities every two weeks
Children eagerly await the bookmobile's arrival each month

definitions: person or business that sells books to the public
examples: The independent bookseller recommended several new titles
Online booksellers have changed the publishing industry

definitions: shelf on which books are stored typically part of a bookcase
examples: She organized her bookshelf by author's last name
The bookshelf sagged under the weight of heavy textbooks
